result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius W Rowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).
  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).
  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).
  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All court costs, surcharges, assessments, victim witness surcharges.   To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Consecutive to: *12/1/2020  Honorable Jeffrey A. Wagner signed ORDER:  Sentence credit amended to total of 229 days on count one, and on concurrent counts three and four.*
AS TO COUNT ONE AND TWO, EACH COUNT:  Consecutive to each other.

superMiscConds.notes: Not to have any  contact with victm.

Participate in domestic violence programs and treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
*Pay all costs, assessments and surcharges imposed in counts three and four in 15CF48 be paid during Extended Supervision.

Defendasnt advised as a convicted felon he may not carrry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
Consecutive to: STATED IN COUNT ONE

Concurrent with: *12/1/2020  Sentence credit amended to 229 days.*
AS TO COUNTS THREE AND FOUR, EACH COUNT:  concurrent with each other and concurrent with counts one and two.

Concurrent with: *12/1/2020  Sentence credit amended to 229 days.*
AS STATED IN COUNT THREE.

cf

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.   Statements by state, defense and defendant.    State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
AS to counts 1 and 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 53 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to each other, credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 39 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 14 MONTHS
AS to counts 3 and 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 53 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, concurrent with each other and concurrent with counts 1 and 2, credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 39 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 14 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.  Court ordered that all costs, assessments and surcharges imposed in counts 3 and 4 in 15CF48 be paid during Extended Supervision.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
Defendant is not to have any contact with victim.
Defendant is to participate in domestic violence programs and treatment.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety with random screens.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant remanded.
Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explantion of Determinate Sentence; Ineligible Voting

Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-18-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Demetrius W Rowe not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Parties have not had sufficient time to review the PSI.  Court will grant adjournment of sentencing hearing.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.

Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea to be entered by defendant.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal of the repeater enhancers on COUNTS #1, #2, #3 and #4.

AS TO COUNTS #1, #2, #3 and #4 (without the repeater enhancer), Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  On both the motion of the State and defense counsel, Court ordered a Presentence Investigation without recommendation.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-2-2015 at 8:30 am.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.   mld

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
P.M. 
Jury in box.  Sworn for the State: Continued testimony of Milwaukee County DA Investigator Carl Buschmann on cross examination.  Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily agreed to testify.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn for Defense: Demetrious Rowe (defendant).  Jury out of the box.  Settlement was discussed by parties.  No settlement reached by parties.  Court ordered Jury Trial continued in Branch 4 on 4-16-2015 at 10:00 am.    mld

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
A.M.
Trial continued.  Jury in box.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Kenton Burtch and Milwaukee Police Officer Miles Kowalik.  Exhibits 8 through 17 received.  Exhibits 8 through 17 is published to the jury.  Jury out of the box.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County DA Investigator Carl Buschmann.  Exhibit 18 received.  Jury out of the box.  Jury in the box.  Trial resumed with previously sworn: Carl Buschmann on direct examination.  Exhibits 20 and 21 were played in open court.  Jury out of the box.  Exhibits 19, 20 and 21 received.  Stipulation placed on the record.  Court recessed for lunch.   mld

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Witness Monica H. sworn outside the presence of the jury.  Jury back in the box at 1:50 p.m.  Sworn for the State:  Monica H.  911 audio recording presented to the Jury.  Sworn for the State:  Claire Zellmer.  Exhibits 3-5 offered and received.   Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer James McNichols.  At the hour of 4:30 p.m., Court recesses matter until April 15, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Opening statements concluded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Michael Rublee.  Exhibits 1 and 2 offered and received.  Victim Monica H. appears at 11:45.  Warrant to remain in effect until after victim provides her testimony.  Matter adjourned for the lunch hour.  Jurors instructed to return at 1:30 p.m. this date for continuation of trial.

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
A.M.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire continued at the hour of 9:24 am.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury out of the box.  In chambers discussions, including strikes for cause, are placed on the record.  State requests a body attachment against the witness, Monica H., (for case 2015CF48), who was personally served on 4-13-2015, for today's proceedings, and failed to appear.  Jury in box. Court instructed jury. Opening statements by the State.  mld

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Demetrius W Rowe not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Cases 2015CF48 and 2015CF819.  Global offer will be forwarded to defense counsel, via email, per the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 3-24-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 4-13-2015 at 8:30 am.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms, per the Court. 

Court heard and granted the motion of the State, for an Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MONICA H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Demetrius W Rowe in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
